snippet: In one notable revelation, the disclosure of the Assembly speaker, Sheldon Silver, showed that he earned $350,000 to $450,000 last year.
abstract: Financial disclosure filings show some of most influential members of New York State Legislature earn large paychecks from part-time jobs with law firms; one notable revelation is disclosure from Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver showing he earned $350,000 to $450,000 in 2012; disclosures are part of new state ethics law that requires legislators to reveal outside income.

byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN and DANNY HAKIM

lead_paragraph: In one notable revelation, the disclosure of the Assembly speaker, Sheldon Silver, showed that he earned $350,000 to $450,000 last year.

headline.main: Legislators Reap Benefits of Part-Time Jobs at Law Firms, Filings Show
headline.print_headline: Legislators Reap Benefits of Part-Time Jobs at Law Firms, Filings Show
